<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 347, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
0606/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 267, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Non- calculator  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 325, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 805, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- Calculators must not be used in this paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 212, 601]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 75, 570, 91]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 107, 784, 125]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\). \((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 156, 675, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 204, 685, 221]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 247, 683, 275]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 297, 685, 323]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 350, 660, 367]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation For the equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 369, 564, 402]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 446, 228, 463]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 437, 910, 479]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^n = a^n + \binom{n}{1} a^{n-1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n-2}b^2 + \ldots + \binom{n}{r} a^{n-r}b^r + \ldots + b^n,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 484, 774, 523]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!r!}\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 555, 220, 571]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 555, 670, 595]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = a + (n-1)d \\ S_n = \frac{1}{2}n(a+l) = \frac{1}{2}n\{2a+(n-1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 631, 220, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 630, 574, 710]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = ar^{n-1} \\ S_n = \frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} \quad (r \neq 1) \\ S_\infty = \frac{a}{1-r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 743, 161, 758]]<|/det|>
Identities 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 740, 560, 790]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A = 1 \\ \sec^2 A = 1 + \tan^2 A \\ \cosec^2 A = 1 + \cot^2 A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 830, 243, 846]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\) 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 826, 580, 900]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \\ a^2 = b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A \\ \Delta = \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 72, 665, 89]]<|/det|>
<form>Calculators must not be used in this paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 103, 99, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 104, 144, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 121, 797, 445]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 464, 863, 483]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=(2 x+a)(x+b)(x+c)\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 495, 363, 512]]<|/det|>
Find values for \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 714, 144, 730]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 712, 586, 730]]<|/det|>
(b) Use the graph to find the values of \(x\) for which \(y \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 78, 792, 97]]<|/det|>
2 Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \(x^{2}+4 k x+k+3=0\) has two equal roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 371, 97, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[107, 371, 688, 405]]<|/det|>
3 The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}\) is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x)=x^{3}+A x+30\), where \(A\) is a constant. When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x+2\) the remainder is 84 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 418, 437, 435]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 546, 91]]<|/det|>
5 Solutions by accurate drawing will not be accepted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 536, 123]]<|/det|>
A circle, \(C\), has equation \(\left(x-5\right)^{2}+\left(y-12\right)^{2}=100\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 138, 144, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 136, 598, 154]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the equation of the tangent to \(C\) at the point (11, 4).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 152, 720, 170]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(ax + by = c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 523, 144, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 521, 718, 539]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that \(C\) and the circle with equation \(x^{2}+y^{2}=4\) do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 702, 91]]<|/det|>
6 Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the following curves.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 98, 625, 131]]<|/det|>
\[
y=4 \ln x \quad \text { and } \quad y=5-\frac{3}{\ln \left(x^{2}\right)}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 380, 152]]<|/det|>
Give your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 698, 91]]<|/det|>
7 In this question, all lengths are in centimetres and all angles are in radians.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 98, 653, 230]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 253, 635, 271]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius 6 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 286, 144, 303]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 285, 537, 303]]<|/det|>
(a) It is given that the area of triangle \(A O B\) is \(9 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 316, 342, 333]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\sin \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 488, 144, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 485, 742, 504]]<|/det|>
(b) It is also given that the exact area of the shaded segment is \((15 \pi-9) \mathrm{cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 517, 435, 534]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of the arc \(A B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 72, 102, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
8

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 91, 700, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 300, 562, 327]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y=\frac{3}{x+1}-\frac{x-2}{x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 336, 905, 354]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the curve such that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) is 1 and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\) is 2 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 368, 144, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 365, 426, 384]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the \(y\)-coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 490, 144, 507]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 488, 780, 507]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(A B\) and the curve is

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 508, 542, 534]]<|/det|>
\(\frac{a}{4}-\ln \frac{b}{2}\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 78, 651, 97]]<|/det|>
9 The function \(f\) is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x)=-2 x^{2}+9 x-10\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 110, 144, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 110, 180, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 108, 717, 127]]<|/det|>
(a) (i) Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a+b(x+c)^{2}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 387, 188, 404]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 384, 536, 403]]<|/det|>
(ii) Hence determine whether or not \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 692, 95]]<|/det|>
(b) The function \(g\) is defined by \(\mathrm{~g}(x)=3 \ln (5-2 x)\) for \(0 \leqslant x<2.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 106, 185, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 106, 537, 123]]<|/det|>
(i) On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y=g(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 121, 918, 153]]<|/det|>
State the exact values of the intercepts with the coordinate axes and the equation of any asymptote.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 180, 740, 524]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 558, 188, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 556, 433, 575]]<|/det|>
(ii) Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 743, 191, 759]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 740, 467, 759]]<|/det|>
(iii) Find the domain and range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 757, 517, 774]]<|/det|>
Give each of your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 87, 458, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 485, 361]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four points, \(O, A, B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 370, 583, 397]]<|/det|>
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie in a straight line and are such that \(\frac{A B}{A C}=\frac{1}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 404, 290, 421]]<|/det|>
\(\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{O B}=\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 437, 144, 454]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 435, 388, 452]]<|/det|>
(a) Find \(\overrightarrow{O C}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 452, 332, 467]]<|/det|>
Simplify your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 675, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) The line \(O A\) is extended to the point \(D\) such that \(O A: A D=2:7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 95, 463, 111]]<|/det|>
Point \(E\) lies on \(C D\) such that \(\overrightarrow{O E}=\lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 127, 314, 143]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 109, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 74, 678, 91]]<|/det|>
11 A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line and passes through a fixed point \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 88, 621, 106]]<|/det|>
At time \(t\) seconds, its displacement from \(O, s\) metres, is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[285, 115, 576, 138]]<|/det|>
\[
s=t+6 t^{2}-t^{3} \text { for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 3
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[285, 144, 777, 173]]<|/det|>
\[
s=12 t-\frac{1}{3} t^{2}-3 \text { for } 3 \leqslant t \leqslant k \quad \text { where } k \text { is a constant. }
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 180, 814, 199]]<|/det|>
It is given that, for \(3 \leqslant t \leqslant k\), the velocity of \(P\) is positive and its acceleration is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 214, 144, 230]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 212, 532, 230]]<|/det|>
(a) The maximum velocity of \(P\) occurs when \(t=2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 227, 858, 246]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch a velocity–time graph for the first \(k\) seconds of the motion of \(P\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 257, 737, 540]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 621, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) The total distance travelled by \(P\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant k\) is 57 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 104, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
Given that when \(t=3\) the distance and displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) are equal, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 83, 107, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 78, 852, 107]]<|/det|>
12 The normal to the curve \(y=\frac{4}{x^{2}}+a x+7\) at the point where \(x=2\) has equation \(x+4 y=b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 114, 328, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).
